Development consent must not be granted for development on land in an urban release area unless a development control plan that provides for the matters specified in subclause (3) has been prepared for the land.
The development control plan must provide for all of the following—
a staging plan for the timely and efficient release of urban land, making provision for necessary infrastructure and sequencing,

an overall transport movement hierarchy showing the major circulation routes and connections to achieve a simple and safe movement system for private vehicles, public transport, pedestrians and cyclists,

an overall landscaping strategy for the protection and enhancement of riparian areas and remnant vegetation, including visually prominent locations, and detailed landscaping requirements for both the public and private domain,
a network of active and passive recreation areas,
stormwater and water quality management controls,

amelioration of natural and environmental hazards, including bush fire, flooding and site contamination and, in relation to natural hazards, the safe occupation of, and the evacuation from, any land so affected,
detailed urban design controls for significant development sites,
measures to encourage higher density living around transport, open space and service nodes,
measures to accommodate and control appropriate neighbourhood commercial and retail uses,
suitably located public facilities and services, including provision for appropriate traffic management facilities and parking.
Subclause (2) does not apply to development for any of the following purposes—
a subdivision for the purpose of a realignment of boundaries that does not create additional lots,
a subdivision of land if any of the lots proposed to be created is to be reserved or dedicated for public open space, public roads or any other public or environment protection purpose,
a subdivision of land in a zone in which the erection of structures is prohibited,

development on land that is of a minor nature only, if the consent authority is of the opinion that the carrying out of the development would be consistent with the objectives of the zone in which the land is situated.

heading.b: Relationship between Part and remainder of Plan

block.txt: A provision of this Part prevails over any other provision of this Plan to the extent of any inconsistency.
The objectives of this clause are as follows—

to provide for the effective and ongoing operation of the Bathurst Airport by ensuring that the operation of the airport is not compromised by proposed development that penetrates the Limitation or Operations Surface for that airport,
to protect the community from undue risk from that operation.

If a development application is received and the consent authority is satisfied that the proposed development will penetrate the Limitation or Operations Surface, the consent authority must not grant development consent unless it has consulted with the relevant Commonwealth body about the application.
The consent authority may grant development consent for the development if the relevant Commonwealth body advises that—
the development will penetrate the Limitation or Operations Surface but it has no objection to its construction, or
the development will not penetrate the Limitation or Operations Surface.

The consent authority must not grant development consent for the development if the relevant Commonwealth body advises that the development will penetrate the Limitation or Operations Surface and should not be carried out.
In this clause—

Limitation or Operations Surface means the Obstacle Limitation Surface or the Procedures for Air Navigation Services Operations Surface as shown on the Obstacle Limitation Surface Map or the Procedures for Air Navigation Services Operations Surface Map for the Bathurst Airport.

relevant Commonwealth body means the body, under Commonwealth legislation, that is responsible for development approvals for development that penetrates the Limitation or Operations Surface for the Bathurst Airport.

heading.b: Development in areas subject to aircraft noise

block.txt: The objectives of this clause are as follows—
to prevent certain noise sensitive developments from being located near the Bathurst Airport and its flight paths,
to assist in minimising the impact of aircraft noise from that airport and its flight paths by requiring appropriate noise attenuation measures in noise sensitive buildings,
to ensure that land use and development in the vicinity of that airport do not hinder or have any other adverse impacts on the ongoing, safe and efficient operation of that airport.
This clause applies to development that—
is on land that—
is near the Bathurst Airport, and
is in an ANEF contour of 20 or greater, and
the consent authority considers is likely to be adversely affected by aircraft noise.
In deciding whether to grant development consent to development to which this clause applies, the consent authority—
must consider whether the development will result in an increase in the number of dwellings or people affected by aircraft noise, and
must consider the location of the development in relation to the criteria set out in Table 2.1 (Building Site Acceptability Based on ANEF Zones) in AS 2021—2000, and
must be satisfied the development will meet the indoor design sound levels shown in Table 3.3 (Indoor Design Sound Levels for Determination of Aircraft Noise Reduction) in AS 2021—2000.
In this clause—
AS 2021—2000 means AS 2021—2000, Acoustics—Aircraft noise intrusion—Building siting and construction.

Development consent must not be granted to development unless the consent authority is satisfied that any of the following services that are essential for the development are available or that adequate arrangements have been made to make them available when required—
the supply of water,
the supply of electricity,
the disposal and management of sewage,
stormwater drainage or on-site conservation,
suitable vehicular access.
The objectives of this clause are as follows—
to ensure development in and around the Mount Panorama Racing Circuit accounts for potential noise and other land use conflicts associated with motor racing and related events,
to ensure the future of Mount Panorama as an international motor racing circuit.
This clause applies to land identified as “50 dBA” on the Mount Panorama Environs Map.
Development consent must not be granted to development on land to which this clause applies unless the consent authority has considered—

whether the development will result in an increase in the number of dwellings or land uses identified by the consent authority as sensitive noise receivers exposed to noise and other land use conflicts from motor racing and associated events, and

whether noise impacts from motor racing and associated events are mitigated by or minimised by the design, siting or construction of the development to ensure that the amenity of the development is not adversely affected.

heading.b: Mount Panorama tourist and visitor accommodation and eco-tourist facilities

block.txt: The objective of this clause is to regulate tourist and visitor accommodation and eco-tourist facilities in Zone RU2 Rural Landscape.

Development consent must not be granted for development for the purpose of tourist and visitor accommodation or eco-tourist facilities in Zone RU2 Rural Landscape unless the consent authority is satisfied that—
if the land on which the development is to be located already contains a lawful dwelling house—the development will be erected within 50 metres of the dwelling house, and
the development will be erected at least 40 metres away from the boundary with the Mount Panorama racing circuit, and
each accommodation unit provided within the development will not have a gross floor area of more than 120 square metres, and
the development will not be used by the same person for more than 42 days (whether consecutive or not) in any calendar year, and
the development will not result in the construction of any additional vehicular access point to the land.

heading.b: Mount Panorama commercial motor race hosting

block.txt: Despite any other provisions of this Plan, development for the purpose of commercial motor race hosting is prohibited, except within Zone SP3 Tourist.

In this clause, commercial motor race hosting means the use of land to provide viewing areas for motor racing for a fee or reward to 13 or more persons. It may or may not include provision for accommodation, food or drink.

heading.b: Conservation incentives for heritage conservation areas

block.txt: Despite any other provision of this Plan, development consent may be granted for development for any purpose relating to a building that is a heritage item or in a heritage conservation area or, in the opinion of the consent authority, a building of heritage significance, or to land on which such a building is erected, if the consent authority is satisfied that—
the conservation of the building will be facilitated by the granting of consent, and
the development is in accordance with a heritage management document that has been approved by the consent authority, and
the development will not adversely affect the heritage significance of the building, including its setting, and
the development will not have any significant adverse effect on the amenity of the surrounding area.
A development consent granted under this clause is to be granted on the condition that all necessary conservation work identified in the heritage management document is to be carried out.

Despite any other provision of this Plan, the consent authority may, when considering an application for development consent to erect a building on land on which a heritage item is located or on land within a heritage conservation area, for the purpose of determining—
the floor space ratio, and
the number of parking spaces to be provided on the site,

exclude the floor space of the heritage item or the existing building in the heritage conservation area from its calculation of the floor space of the buildings erected on the land, but only if the consent authority is satisfied that the conservation of the heritage item or the existing building in the heritage conservation area depends on its making the exclusion.
Development consent must not be granted to the erection of signage on any land, except land in Zone SP3 Tourist, unless—
the signage relates to the approved use of the site and is located on the land on which that use is being conducted, and
the dimensions and overall size of the signage is not larger than would reasonably be required so to inform the public.

Despite subclause (1), development consent may be granted to the erection of signage on any land for the specific purpose of directing the travelling public to educational establishments, tourist facilities or places of scientific, historic or scenic interest, if the consent authority is satisfied that—
the signage relates to a specific building or place within Bathurst Regional local government area, and
the principal purpose of the signage is to direct the travelling public to that building or place, and
the dimensions and overall size of the signage are not larger than would reasonably be required so to direct the travelling public.
Despite subclause (1), development consent may be granted to a directory board sign on any land if the consent authority is satisfied that—
the directory board sign relates to a business or industrial estate or park in the Bathurst Regional local government area and is located at the entrance to that estate or park, and
the dimensions and overall size of the signage are not larger than would reasonably be required to direct the public to the business or industrial estate or park.
Despite subclause (1), development consent may be granted to signage of a temporary nature on any land if the consent authority is satisfied that—
the signage relates to a local event within the Bathurst Regional local government area, and
the signage will not be displayed for more than 28 days before the event or 7 days after the event.
Despite subclause (1), development consent may be granted to signage on any land for the specific purpose of advertising premises for sale or for lease.
Despite subclause (1), development consent may be granted to interpretive signage on any land for the specific purpose of interpreting the built or natural environment or an item of historic nature.
In this clause—
directory board sign means a sign that displays a business identification sign for 2 or more businesses.
interpretive signage means a sign that displays interpretive information for a building or place of a historic, environmental or scenic nature.

heading.b: Subdivision of land in Mount Haven Estate, Meadow Flat

block.txt: This clause applies to land in DP 270159, known as the Mount Haven Estate, Meadow Flat, being land partly in Zone RU1 Primary Production and partly in Zone C4 Environmental Living.

Despite any other provision of this Plan, development consent must not be granted to subdivide land to which this clause applies unless the subdivision is under the Community Land Development Act 1989 and the land is subdivided so as to create no more than—
42 dwelling lots having an average area of not more than 4 hectares, a minimum area of not less than 2 hectares, and a maximum area of not more than 6 hectares, and
6 lots having an area of not less than 1 hectare, and
5 neighbourhood property lots having an area of not less than 1 hectare, and
a community property lot, and
a farm lot and associated dwelling house having an area of not less than 480 hectares.

Development consent must not be granted to a stage of subdivision of land to which this clause applies after the initial stage unless the consent authority is satisfied that at least 60 per cent of lots created in the initial or previous stage under subclause (2)(a) and (b) have been sold and the consent authority is satisfied that the common effluent disposal system for the initial or previous stage is functioning satisfactorily.
Despite any other provision of this Plan, development consent may be granted to the erection of a dwelling house on a lot created in accordance with subclause (2)(a) or (b).
Despite any other provision of this Plan, development consent must not be granted to the erection of a dwelling house—
on a lot created in accordance with subclause (2)(c) or (d), or
on land identified as “Dwelling—House Prohibited” on the Mount Haven Estate Map.
Despite any other provision of this Plan, development consent must not be granted to the use of Part Lot 8, Section 104, DP 758065 for a purpose other than a gasworks.
Development consent must not be granted for development for the purposes of sex services premises if the premises will be located on land that adjoins, or that is separated only by a road from, land—

in Zone RU1 Primary Production, Zone RU2 Rural Landscape, Zone RU4 Primary Production Small Lot, Zone RU5 Village, Zone R1 General Residential, Zone R2 Low Density Residential, Zone R5 Large Lot Residential, Zone E1 Local Centre, Zone E2 Commercial Centre, Zone E3 Productivity Support, Zone SP1 Special Uses, Zone SP2 Infrastructure, Zone SP3 Tourist, Zone C2 Environmental Conservation, Zone C4 Environmental Living, Zone RE1 Public Recreation, Zone RE2 Private Recreation and Zone W2 Recreational Waterways, or
used as a place of public worship or for community or school uses.
In deciding whether to grant development consent to any such development, the consent authority must consider the impact that the development would have on children who use the land.
The objective of this clause is to protect drinking water catchments by minimising the adverse impacts of development on the quality and quantity of water entering drinking water storages.
This clause applies to land identified as “Drinking water catchment” on the Drinking Water Catchment Map.
In deciding whether to grant a development application for development on land to which this clause applies, the consent authority must consider the following—
whether or not the development is likely to have any adverse impact on the quality and quantity of water entering the drinking water storage, having regard to the following—
the distance between the development and any waterway that feeds into the drinking water storage,
the on-site use, storage and disposal of any chemicals on the land,
the treatment, storage and disposal of waste water and solid waste generated or used by the development,
any appropriate measures proposed to avoid, minimise or mitigate the impacts of the development.
Development consent must not be granted to development on land to which this clause applies unless the consent authority is satisfied that—
the development is designed, sited and will be managed to avoid any significant adverse impact on water quality and flows, or
if that impact cannot be reasonably avoided—the development is designed, sited and will be managed to minimise that impact, or
if that impact cannot be minimised—the development will be managed to mitigate that impact.

The objective of this clause is to maintain the commercial hierarchy of Bathurst and to manage the amenity of the surrounding residential areas by encouraging certain commercial premises of an appropriate scale within Zone E1 Local Centre.
This clause applies to development for the following purposes on land in Zone E1 Local Centre—
landscaping material supplies,
local distribution premises,
rural supplies,
specialised retail premises,
timber yards,
vehicle sales and hire premises.
Development consent must not be granted to development to which this clause applies if the gross floor area of the development will exceed 400m2.
In deciding whether to grant development consent to development to which this clause applies, the consent authority must—
consider the economic impact of the development, and
be satisfied that the development is consistent with the commercial hierarchy of Bathurst.

heading.b: Minimum subdivision lot size for certain battle-axe lots in Laffing Waters and Kelso

block.txt: This clause applies to the following land, to the extent the land is in Zone R1 General Residential—
Lot 231, DP 1177478, 151 Laffing Waters Lane, Laffing Waters,
Lot 12, DP 857116, 183 Laffing Waters Lane, Laffing Waters,
Lot 401, DP 1285473, Marsden Lane, Kelso,
Lot 2, DP 716660, 130 Laffing Waters Lane, Laffing Waters,
Lot 8, DP 788492, Laffing Waters Lane, Kelso.
The size of a battle-axe lot, or another lot with an access handle, resulting from the subdivision of the land must not be less than 900m2.
If a lot is a battle-axe lot or other lot with an access handle, the area of the access handle must not be included in calculating the lot size.

heading.b: Development of land at Howick Street and George Street, Bathurst

block.txt: This clause applies to development—
for the purposes of health service facilities on the following land at 252 Howick Street, Bathurst—
Lots A and B, DP 163425,
Lot 17, DP 584625, and
for the purposes of car parks on Lot 11, DP 1160748, George Street, Bathurst.
Development consent must not be granted to development to which this clause applies unless the consent authority has considered the following—
the impact of the proposed development on vehicular and pedestrian traffic in the area,
whether the proposed development will exhibit design excellence.
In considering whether the development will exhibit design excellence, the consent authority must consider the following—
whether the development will achieve a high standard of architectural design, materials and detailing appropriate to the building types and location,
whether the design of the development addresses heritage issues and streetscape constraints,
whether the development will incorporate setbacks that minimise the overall bulk of the building and improve solar access,
whether the development will improve the quality and amenity of the public domain,
whether the development is consistent with the document entitled Future Proofing Our CBD—2022 and Beyond, published by the Bathurst Regional Council in September 2022.
The maximum floor space ratio for a building used for the purposes of health services facilities on land specified in subclause (1)(a)(i)–(v) is 2.6:1.
The maximum height of a building used for the purposes of health services facilities on land specified in subclause (1)(a)(i)–(v) is 29m.
The maximum height of a building used for the purposes of car parks on land specified in subclause (1)(b) is 21m.
(Clause 2.5)

heading.b: Use of certain land at 24 Station Street, Brewongle

block.txt: This clause applies to land at 24 Station Street, Brewongle, being Lots 3 and 4, DP 222793.
Development for the purpose of one dwelling house is permitted with development consent subject to the consolidation of the lots.

heading.b: Use of certain land at 656 Cow Flat Road, Cow Flat and 864 Cow Flat Road, Fosters Valley

block.txt: This clause applies to land at 656 Cow Flat Road, Cow Flat, being Lots 1 and 2, DP 125193 and Lot 1, DP 1139877 and 864 Cow Flat Road, Fosters Valley, being Lots 281–283, DP 878616.
Development for the purpose of a subdivision of land is permitted with development consent if the subdivision—
creates no more than 3 lots no larger than 10 hectares each within Lot 282, DP 878616, and
consolidates Lots 1 and 2, DP 125193 and Lot 1, DP 1139877 into a single lot, and
consolidates Lots 281 and 283, DP 878616 and the residue of Lot 282, DP 878616 into a single lot, and
Development for the purpose of a dwelling house is permitted with development consent on each of the lots created under subclause (2)(a) and (c).
No further subdivision is permitted of the consolidated lots created under subclause (2)(b) and (c).

heading.b: Use of certain land at 18 Hobson Close, Eglinton

block.txt: This clause applies to land at 18 Hobson Close, Eglinton, being Lot 1, DP 1047811.
Development for the purpose of a subdivision of the land is permitted with development consent if the existing dwelling house on the land will be located on a resulting lot of at least 0.6 hectares.

heading.b: Use of certain land at Mid-Western Highway, Evans Plains

block.txt: This clause applies to land at Mid Western Highway, Evans Plains, being Lots 1–9, DP 817711.
Development for the purpose of a subdivision of land that creates—
no more than 8 lots of not less than 10 hectares and not more than 15 hectares each, and
no more than one lot of more than 300 hectares,
is permitted with development consent.
Development for the purpose of a dwelling house is permitted with development consent on each of the 9 lots created under subclause (2).
Further subdivision of the land is prohibited.

heading.b: Use of certain land at Stewart Street, Evans Plains

block.txt: This clause applies to land at Stewart Street, Evans Plains, being Lots 1 and 2, DP 114143, Lots 1 and 2, Section 20, DP 758719, Lots 1–10, Section 12, DP 758719, Lots 4–7, Section 11, DP 758719 and Lot 1, DP 998613.
Development for the purpose of a dwelling house is permitted with development consent subject to the consolidation of all of the lots to which this clause applies into a single lot.

heading.b: Use of certain land at Limekilns Road, Ardsley Lane and Koonong Place, Forest Grove

block.txt: This clause applies to land at Limekilns Road and Ardsley Lane, Forest Grove, being Lot 103, DP 1114363, Lot 1, DP 67467 and Lot 1, DP 977426.
Development for the purpose of a subdivision is permitted with development consent if the subdivision creates—
no more than 2 lots with an area of not more than 10.5 hectares each within Lot 103, DP 1114363, and
no more than 3 lots within Lot 1, DP 67467, Lot 1, DP 977426 and the residue of Lot 103, DP 1114363, being,
one lot with an area of not more than 202 hectares, and
one lot of approximately 682 hectares (containing the existing dwelling known as “Ardsley”), and
one lot of approximately 277 hectares.
Development for the purpose of a dwelling house is permissible with development consent on each new lots mentioned in subclause (2)(a).
No further dwellings are permitted with development consent on the lot mentioned in subclause (2)(b)(iii).
No further subdivision is permitted on the lot of approximately 682 hectares mentioned in subclause (2)(b)(ii).
Development for the purposes of a dwelling house is prohibited on the land comprising Lot 103, DP 1114363 before the subdivision of that lot under subclause (2).

heading.b: Use of certain land at 51 Gormans Hill Road, Gormans Hill

block.txt: This clause applies to land at 51 Gormans Hill Road, Gormans Hill, being Lot 12, DP 1159190.
Development for the purposes of centre-based child care facilities, office premises, respite day care centres and seniors housing is permitted with development consent.

heading.b: Use of certain land at Sydney Road, Kelso

block.txt: This clause applies to land at Sydney Road, Kelso, being Part Lot 2, DP 1079829 and Part Lot 1, DP 1093933.

Development for the purposes of freight transport terminals and warehouse or distribution centres is permitted with development consent on that part of the land identified as “1” on the Additional Permitted Uses Map.

heading.b: Use of certain land at 89 Blacks Mill Lane, O’Connell

block.txt: This clause applies to land at 89 Blacks Mill Lane, O’Connell, being Lot 1, DP 869643 and Lot 35, DP 755784.
Development for the purpose of a dwelling house on each lot is permitted with development consent.

heading.b: Use of certain land at Rockley Road, Rockley Mount

block.txt: Use of certain land at Rockley Road, Rockley Mount being Lot 215, DP 750354.
Development for the purpose of a dwelling house is permitted with development consent.

heading.b: Use of certain land at 1407 Freemantle Road, Watton

block.txt: This clause applies to land at 1407 Freemantle Road, Watton, being Lot 37, DP 755801.
Development for the purpose of a dwelling house is permitted with development consent.
(Clause 3.1)

State Environmental Planning Policy (Exempt and Complying Development Codes) 2008 specifies exempt development under that Policy. The Policy has State-wide application. This Schedule contains additional exempt development not specified in that Policy.

Exempt development may be carried out without the need for development consent under the Act. Such development is not exempt from any approval, licence, permit or authority that is required under any other Act and adjoining owners’ property rights and the common law still apply.

Despite Note 1, under clause 1.9(3) of State Environmental Planning Policy (Exempt and Complying Development Codes) 2008 this Plan continues to apply to that development and under clause 1.9(10) of that Policy that development may be carried out under this Plan or that Policy.

Development that is the installation of photovoltaic cells, small wind turbine systems, and solar energy systems (including solar hot water systems) may be carried out as exempt development under State Environmental Planning Policy (Transport and Infrastructure) 2021, Chapter 2.
The construction or installation of an access ramp is development specified for this Schedule.
Must be constructed in accordance with AS 1428.1—2009, Design for access and mobility, Part 1: General requirements for access—New building work.
If located over the existing house drainage pipelines, access to the inspection openings must be maintained at all times.
If constructed or installed on or in, or in relation to, a heritage item—must be located behind the front building line.
Must not interfere with the functioning of existing drainage fixtures or the natural surface flow of water.
Must not be situated on a lot identified as “Flood Planning Area” on the Flood Planning Map.
If located on bush fire prone land and less than 10m from a dwelling—must be constructed of non-combustible material.
Must be erected within the property boundary.
Must be 1.2m clear of any 150mm diameter sewer main or 2m clear of any 225mm (or greater) diameter sewer main.
Must not be constructed over any easement.
Must be clear of the zone of influence of any sewer main in accordance with the Council’s Drawing No. EN7902 available on the Council’s website.
Must not be more than one per building or dwelling, unless located behind the building line and not visible from any road or public area.

See AS 1428.1—2009, Design for access and mobility, Part 1: General requirements for access—New building work and the Disability (Access to Premises—Buildings) Standards 2010 under the Disability Discrimination Act 1992 of the Commonwealth which specifies the design requirements for new building work to provide access for people with disabilities.

The construction or installation of an aerial or antenna, including microwave antennae, is development specified for this Schedule if it is only for the purpose of receiving television or radio signals or for use in connection with community band or two-way radio (or any combination of these uses).
If it is roof mounted—must not be higher than 2.5m above the highest point of the roof.
If it is not roof mounted—must—
be not higher than 2.5m above the highest point of the roof of the dwelling on the lot, and
except on land within Zone RU1, Zone RU2, Zone RU3 or Zone RU4—be located in the rear yard, and
not be located on a lot identified as “Flood Planning Area” on the Flood Planning Map.
Must be structurally sound and capable of supporting the dead and live (wind) loads that may be imposed on the development and the supporting structure.
Must not be more than one per building or dwelling, unless located behind the building line, and not visible from a road or a public area.

heading.b: Air-conditioning units and evaporative cooling units

block.txt: The construction or installation of an air-conditioning or evaporative cooling unit is development specified for this Schedule.
Must be located within the property boundary.
Must not be located on land in Zone RU5 within the village of Hill End.
Must not reduce the structural integrity of the building.
Must not dispose of condensation in a manner that damages or causes nuisance to adjoining properties including roads and public places.
Any opening created must be adequately waterproofed.
Must not reduce the existing fire resistance level of a wall.
Must not be more than one per building or dwelling, unless located behind the building line, and not visible from a road or public area.
Must not be higher than 1.8m above the highest point of the roof of the building on which it is located.
Must not be audible inside the interior of any adjoining dwelling between 10 pm and 7 am on weekdays and 10 pm and 8 am on Saturdays, Sundays and public holidays.
Noise levels must not exceed 5dB(A) above ambient background noise level, measured at the property boundary.
If within a heritage conservation area or on a heritage item—must be located behind the building line and not be visible from a road or a public place or extend above the roof line.
If it is constructed or installed on or in, or in relation to, a heritage item—must not be wall or roof mounted.

heading.b: Animal shelters (including aviaries, fowl and poultry houses, dog kennels, horse stables and yards)

block.txt: The construction or installation of an animal shelter is development specified for this Schedule.
Must be on land within Zone RU1, Zone RU2, Zone RU4, Zone RU5, Zone R1, Zone R2, Zone R5, Zone E1, Zone E2 or Zone E4.
Must not be used for commercial purposes (other than for agriculture).
Maximum wall height—3m.
Maximum overall height—4.5m.
If within Zone R1, Zone R2, Zone R5, Zone RU5, Zone E1, Zone E2 or Zone E4, must—
have a maximum building floor area of 30m2, and
be located behind the front building alignment.
If within Zone RU1, Zone RU2 or Zone RU4 must have a maximum building floor area of 60m2.
Must be constructed or installed so that any stormwater from the roof is disposed of into an existing stormwater drainage system or other lawful place for stormwater discharge.
Must be constructed of non-reflective materials or painted before use.
Horse stables must be a minimum 9m from any building used for the manufacture, production or storage of food or from land used for public purposes.
Must be located so that it does not cause nuisance (for example noise, odour or vermin) to neighbouring properties.
If proposed to be located over the existing house drainage pipelines—access to the inspection openings must be maintained at all times.
If constructed or installed on or in, or in relation to, a heritage item—must be located in the rear yard, unless it is located in Zone RU1, Zone RU2 or Zone RU4.
If located on bush fire prone land and the structure is attached to or shares a common roof space with the dwelling, must comply with AS 3959:2018, Construction of buildings in bushfire-prone areas.
Must be erected within the property boundary.
Must be 1.2m clear of any 150mm diameter sewer main or 2m clear of any 225mm (or greater) diameter sewer main.
Must not be constructed over any easement.
Must be clear of the zone of influence of any sewer main in accordance with the Council’s Drawing No. EN7902 available on the Council’s website.
Must not be within 40m of a perennial or intermittent named waterway.
If constructed in Zone R1 or Zone R2—
must not be more than one development per dwelling on the lot (except for aviaries), and
must not house more than 5 fowl or poultry and not house any roosters.
Must not be located on a lot located in the “Flood Planning Area” identified on the Flood Planning Map.
The construction or installation of an automatic teller machine is development specified for this Schedule.
Must be located in and accessed from inside an existing business, retail premises or specialised retail premises.
Must not be located in the external wall of an existing business or retail premises unless accessed from inside the existing building.

heading.b: Awnings, blinds and canopies (including storm, sun and security blinds)

block.txt: The construction or installation of an awning, blind (including a storm blind, security blind or sun blind), canopy or similar structure over a window or door opening is development specified for this Schedule.
The height must not exceed the highest point of the ridge line of the main building.
Must not be enclosed.
Must be constructed of non-reflective materials or painted before use.
If located over the existing house drainage pipelines, access to the inspection openings must be maintained at all times.
If the same structure already exists on the subject land, the proposed new structure must not be visible from the road or a public area.
Must not be constructed on land in Zone RU5 within the village of Hill End.
If in a heritage conservation area or draft heritage conservation area—must be located behind the front building alignment.
Must not be constructed or installed on, in, or in relation to a heritage item or draft heritage Item.
Must not be used for advertising.

heading.b: Balconies, decks, patios, patio covers, pergolas, terraces, verandahs and shade structures (including attached or detached to a dwelling, roofed and unroofed)

block.txt: The construction or installation of a balcony, deck, patio, patio cover, pergola, terrace, verandah or shade structure (whether attached to or detached from a dwelling, or roofed or unroofed) is development specified for this Schedule.
Maximum floor level height—1m.
Maximum height for shade structures—3.0m.
Must not be constructed or installed on, or in relation to, a heritage item or draft heritage item.
Must be located at least—
4m from a boundary with a primary road, or
2m from a boundary with a secondary road, or
900mm from any other boundary.
If located in a heritage conservation area or draft heritage conservation area, must be located behind any building line for the dwelling to which it relates that fronts a road.
Maximum width of any balcony, deck, patio, patio cover, pergola, terrace or verandah that is forward of the front or side building for the dwelling to which it relates—2m.
Must be constructed or installed so that any stormwater from the roof is disposed of into an existing stormwater drainage system or other lawful place for stormwater discharge.
If connected to a fascia, must be connected in accordance with the specifications of a professional engineer.
Must not be enclosed.
Must be constructed of non-reflective materials or painted before use.
Must not be located over existing house drainage pipelines.
Decks must not be located over gullies unless there is a minimum 2m clearance, alternatively the gully must be relocated so as to be clear of the deck.
The height must not exceed the highest point of the ridge line of the main building.

If located on bush fire prone land and the structure is attached to or shares a common roof space with the dwelling, the structure must comply with AS 3959:2018, Construction of buildings in bushfire-prone areas.
Must not be constructed on land in Zone RU5 within the village of Hill End.
Must be 1.2m clear of any 150mm diameter sewer main or 2.0m clear of any 225mm (or greater) diameter sewer main.
Must not be constructed over any easement.
Must be clear of the zone of influence of any sewer main in accordance with the Council’s Drawing No. EN7902 available on the Council’s website.
Must not be located on a lot identified as “Flood Planning Area” on the Flood Planning Map.

heading.b: Barbecues and other outdoor cooking structures

block.txt: The construction or installation of a barbecue or other outdoor cooking structure is development specified for this Schedule.
Must be located within the property boundary.
Any permanent gas or electricity supply must be connected by a licensed gas fitter or electrician.
Must be located so that it does not cause nuisance (for example noise, odour or smoke) to neighbouring properties.
Must be 1.2m clear of any 150mm diameter sewer main or 2m clear of any 225mm (or greater) diameter sewer main.
Must not be constructed in any easement.
Must be clear of the zone of influence of any sewer main in accordance with the Council’s Drawing No. EN7902 available on the Council’s website.
Must not be constructed over drainage pipes or any house drainage.
Must not be located on a lot identified as “Flood Planning Area” on the Flood Planning Map.
The construction or installation of a bollard is development specified for this Schedule.
Must not reduce the existing means of egress from a building or site.
Must not be higher than 1.5m above the ground level (existing).
If located in the footpath, must be constructed in accordance with the Council’s Drawing No. EN8447 available on the Council’s website.

heading.b: Building alterations (internal and external) to commercial premises, including shop fitouts and recladding of roofs and walls

block.txt: Building alterations (internal and external) to commercial premises, including shop fitouts and recladding of roofs and walls, is development specified for this Schedule.
Must be on land within Zone E1, Zone E2, Zone E3, Zone E4, Zone RU5, Zone R1 or Zone R2.
Maximum gross floor area of the tenancy—300m2.
The building must have been lawfully constructed to be used for the purpose of a commercial premises of a particular kind.
Must involve materials that match the existing materials or match those originally used on the building.
Must not affect the structural adequacy and stability of the building.
Must not involve the removal, re-positioning or increase the number of internal floor levels.
Must not reduce the existing level of fire safety and egress, the existing level of fire resistance, and the existing safeguards against the spread of fire to adjoining properties.
Must not alter the existing footprint of the building.

If the premises are used for the storage or preparation of food—the alterations must not involve the fitout of a new food premises or storage area, unless the building alterations involve the maintenance of the food premises or storage area and involve the replacement of like for like components in accordance with AS 4674—2004, Design, construction and fit-out of food premises.
Must not be constructed or installed on or in, or in relation to, a heritage item.
Must not involve external alterations to shop fronts above awning level.
If on land within Zone E2—must not involve the external painting or rendering of buildings.
Must not be located on a lot identified as “Flood Planning Area” on the Flood Planning Map.

heading.b: Building alterations (internal and external) to dwellings, including recladding of roofs and walls (see also painting and rendering of buildings)

block.txt: Building alterations (internal and external) to dwellings, including recladding of roofs and walls, is development specified for this Schedule.
Must not involve any alterations to structural components of the building.
The building must have been lawfully constructed to be used for the purpose of a dwelling.
Must involve materials that match the existing materials or match those originally used on the building.
Must not change the existing footprint of the building.
Must not change any part of the building from a non-habitable to a habitable use.
Must not reduce the provision of light or ventilation to any room served by any window, glazed area or door.

Replacement materials used must comply with AS 1288—2006, Glass in buildings—Selection and installation and AS/NZS 2208:1996, Safety glazing materials in buildings for use in Buildings (Human Impact Considerations), where applicable.
Must not include a change to the fire resisting components of a building.
In the case of the installation of insulation material, it must be in accordance with Part 3.12.1 of the Building Code of Australia.
In the case of re-cladding, sub-floor ventilation must be retained for the building at the rate of not less than 21,000mm2 per lineal metre of wall.
Must not be constructed or installed on, in or in relation to a heritage item or a draft heritage item.
Must not include the external painting or rendering of face brickwork not previously painted or rendered within a heritage conservation area or in relation to a heritage item.
Must not be located on a lot identified as “Flood Planning Area” on the Flood Planning Map.
Must not involve the use of external combustible cladding, within the meaning of the Environmental Planning and Assessment (Development Certification and Fire Safety) Regulation 2021.

The Plumbing and Drainage Act 2011 specifies who is permitted to carry out plumbing and drainage work and requires that work to comply with the Plumbing Code of Australia. It also provides for the inspection of plumbing and drainage work.

heading.b: Building alterations (internal and external) to industrial premises and agricultural produce Industries, including recladding of roofs and walls

block.txt: Building alterations (internal and external), to industrial premises and agricultural produce industries, including recladding of roofs and walls, is development specified for this Schedule.
Must be on land in Zone RU1, RU2, RU4, RU5, R1, R2, R5, E1, E2, E3, E4 or C4.
Maximum gross floor area—300m2.
The building must have been lawfully constructed to be used for the purpose of an agricultural produce industry or industrial premises of a particular kind.
Must involve materials that match the existing materials or match those originally used on the building.
Must not affect the structural adequacy and stability of a building.
Must not involve the removal, re-positioning or increase the number of internal floor levels.
Must not reduce the existing level of fire safety and egress, the existing level of fire resistance, or the existing safeguards against the spread of fire to adjoining properties.
Must not alter the existing footprint of the building.
The premises must not be used for the preparation of food.
In the case of re-cladding, sub-floor ventilation must be retained for the building at a rate of not less than 21,000mm2 per lineal metre of wall.
Must not be located on a lot identified as “Flood Planning Area” on the Flood Planning Map.
Must not be constructed or installed on, in or in relation to a heritage item or draft heritage item.
Must not involve the use of external combustible cladding, within the meaning of the Environmental Planning and Assessment (Development Certification and Fire Safety) Regulation 2021.

The Plumbing and Drainage Act 2011 specifies who is permitted to carry out plumbing and drainage work and requires that work to comply with the Plumbing Code of Australia. It also provides for the inspection of plumbing and drainage work.

heading.b: Building identification signs and business identification signs

block.txt: The installation of new or the alteration of existing building identification signs or business identification signs is development specified for this Schedule.
Flush wall sign—on land in Zone RU5, Zone R1, Zone R2, Zone R5, Zone E1 or Zone E2—
must be attached to the wall of a building (other than the transom of a doorway or display window) and not project more than 0.3m from the wall, and
maximum area—0.75m2, and
must be below awning level, and
must be displayed on the same land as a lawfully approved development to which the sign relates, and
must not be constructed or installed on or in, or in relation to, a heritage item or draft heritage item.
Flush wall sign—on land in Zone E3 or Zone E4—
must be attached to the wall of a building (other than the transom of a doorway or display window) and not project more than 0.3m from the wall, and
maximum area—6m2, and
must not be more than one sign per building, and
must be displayed on the same land as a lawfully approved development to which the sign relates, and
must not be visible from a classified road, and
must not be constructed or installed on or in, or in relation to, a heritage item or draft heritage item.
Fascia sign—on land in Zone E1, E2, E3 or E4—
must be attached to the fascia or return end of an awning, and
must not extend beyond the depth of the existing building fascia, and
must be displayed on the same land as a lawfully approved development to which the sign relates, and
must not be constructed or installed on or in, or in relation to, a heritage item or draft heritage item.
Pylon sign—on land in Zone E3 or Zone E4—
must be an advertisement erected on a pole or pylon which is independent of any building or structure, and
maximum height—below the roof height of the building on the site, but not greater than 5m (measured from natural ground level to the top of the structure), and
maximum area (sign panel)—4.5m2, and
must not be visible from a classified road, and
must not be located over existing house drainage pipelines, and
must be 1.2m clear of any 150mm diameter sewer main or 2m clear of any 225mm (or greater) diameter sewer main, and
must not be constructed over any easement, and
must be clear of the zone of influence of any sewer main in accordance with the Council’s Drawing No. EN7902 available on the Council’s website, and
must not be more than one sign per property, and
if illuminated—must only be internally illuminated and not up-lit, and
must be displayed on the same land as a lawfully approved development to which the sign relates, and
must not be constructed or installed on or in, or in relation to, a heritage item, or draft heritage item, within a heritage conservation area or a draft heritage conservation area, and
must not be located on a lot identified as “Flood Planning Area” on the Flood Planning Map.
Top hamper sign—on land in Zone E1, E2, E3 or E4—
must be a sign attached to the transom of a doorway or display window of a building, and
must be displayed on the same land as a lawfully approved development to which the sign relates.
Under awning sign—on land in Zone E1, E2, E3 or E4—
must be a sign attached to the underside of an awning (other than the fascia or return end), and
must be displayed on the same land as a lawfully approved development to which the sign relates, and
must not be constructed or installed on or in, or in relation to, a heritage item or draft heritage item.
Changes to wording or content of approved signs in any zone—
must be to a lawfully existing sign, and
must relate to the lawfully approved use of the associated building or place, and
must not be a flashing, illuminated or animated sign, and
must not contain sexually explicit material, and
must not interfere with or confuse interpretation or reading of traffic signals, and
must not result in any additional signage or increase in signage area, and
must not involve painting of the building other than an area previously painted for advertising purposes, and
if within a heritage conservation area or on, in or in relation to a heritage item—must involve traditional colours (bright colours are not permitted).
Building maintenance, repair and restoration is development specified for this Schedule.
Must involve the copying of the existing fabric of the building.
Must involve the repair or replacement of missing or deteriorated components of the building.

Must involve the restoration of components of the place by returning existing fabric to a known earlier location or configuration by removing accretions or by reassembling existing components without the introduction of new material.
Must involve reinstating components such as doors, windows, decorative detail and landscape features and the removal of infills from verandahs, enclosures to fireplaces and minor partitions.
For heritage buildings, repair works should be based on the principle of doing as much as necessary but as little as possible, i.e. only replace the materials that need to be replaced.
The construction or installation of a bus shelter is development specified for this Schedule.
Maximum overall height—4.5m.
Must be erected on parks, recreation areas, public footpaths, or at sporting facilities or playing fields under the control and management of the Council.
Must not be constructed over any easement or other utility service without the express permission from the relevant public authority.
Must not obstruct the line of sight of vehicular traffic.
Must be 1.2m clear of any 150mm diameter sewer main or 2m clear of any 225mm (or greater) diameter sewer main.
Must not be constructed over any easement.
Must be clear of the zone of influence of any sewer main in accordance with the Council’s Drawing No. EN7902 available on the Council’s website.
Must not be constructed over any drainage pipes or any house drainage.
Must be constructed of non-reflective materials or alternatively painted before use.
Must not display an advertisement.
Must not be located on a lot identified as “Flood Planning Area” on the Flood Planning Map.
The use of a caravan or campervan is development specified for this Schedule.
Must be on land within Zone RU1, Zone RU4, Zone RU5 (excluding the village of Hill End), Zone R1, Zone R2 or Zone R5.
Must not be within 40m of a perennial or intermittent named waterway.
If located within a heritage conservation area or heritage item, must not be visible from a road or public place.
If located on land within Zone RU1 or Zone RU4 must be located at least 40m from a public road and—
be occupied seasonally by persons employed in pastoral or agricultural operations on the land, or
if the land is land dedicated or reserved under the Forestry Act 2012, be occupied by persons employed in forestry operations on the land, or

up to 2 additional caravans or campervans (other than those to which paragraph (a) or (b) applies) may be installed so long as they are not occupied for more than 2 days at a time and are not occupied for more than 60 days (in total) in any 12-month period.
If located on land within Zone R1, Zone R2, Zone R5 or Zone RU5 must be—
occupied only by the owner of the land or members of the owner’s household, and
located behind the front building alignment, and
only one per property.
Must not be located over the Council’s sewer access points.
Must not be located on a lot located in the “Flood Planning Area” identified on the Flood Planning Map.
The construction or installation of a carport, garage or garden shed is development specified for this Schedule.
Must not be located on land within Zone RU5 in the village of Hill End.
Maximum building height for a garage or carport, whichever is the lesser of—
4.5m, or
the roof line of any building to which the garage or carport is attached.
Maximum wall height for a garage or carport—3.3m.
Maximum building height for a garden shed—2.4m.
Maximum gross floor area—
if on land within a heritage conservation area or draft heritage conservation area—
for a single carport, garage or garden shed—45m2, or
for all carports, garages and garden sheds on a lot—60m2, or
if on any other land—
for a single carport, garage or garden shed—60m2, or
for all carports, garages and garden sheds on a lot—80m2.
Must not be more than 1 carport, garage or garden shed on a lot with a gross floor area of more than 10m2.
A carport, garage or garden shed on a lot in a heritage conservation area with a gross floor area of more than 10m2 must—
be of a colour that matches the main building on the lot, and
the roof must have a pitch that matches the roof of the main building on the lot or be of at least 30o, and
any steel sheeting used in the construction must be corrugated.
A garage constructed within the footprint of a dwelling is not to be included for the purposes of subclauses (5)–(7).
Must be located—
behind the front building line for a boundary with a primary road, and
at least 900mm from each of the following—
a boundary with a secondary road,
a side boundary,
a rear boundary, and
at least 20m from any boundary if located on land in Zone RU1, Zone RU2 or Zone RU4, and
at least 40m from a boundary adjoining the Mount Panorama Racing Circuit if located on land in Zone RU2.
Must not be a shipping container if located in a heritage conservation area.
If a carport, must have 2 or more sides open and not more than one-third of its perimeter enclosed.
Must be constructed of non-reflective materials or painted before use.
If located in a heritage conservation area, the colouring of materials used must match those used on the main building.
Must not be constructed or installed on or in, or in relation to, a heritage item, other than within Zone RU1 if the carport is not attached to the heritage item.
Must be 1.2m clear of any 150mm diameter sewer main or 2m clear of any 225mm (or greater) diameter sewer main.
Must not be constructed over any easement.
Must be clear of the zone of influence of any sewer main in accordance with the Council’s Drawing No. EN7902 available on the Council’s website.
Must not be located over existing house drainage pipelines.
Must not be located on a lot identified as “Flood Planning Area” on the Flood Planning Map.
Must not be used for habitable, industrial or commercial purposes.
A change from a current use to a new use that is a change from—
a type of business premises to another type of business premises, or
business premises to office premises, or
a type of office premises to another type of office premises, or
office premises to business premises, or
a type of retail premises to another type of retail premises of the same kind (eg. from specialised retail premises to another specialised retail premises), or
a type of light industry to another light industry, or
an industry to another industry or light industry, or
an agricultural produce industry to another type of agricultural produce industry, or
a warehouse or distribution centre to another warehouse or distribution centre, or
an industry or light industry to a warehouse or distribution centre, or
a warehouse or distribution centre to a light industry, or
a community or recreation use to another community or recreation use,
is development specified for this Schedule.
Must not provide any additional floor area.
The proposed use must be consistent with the existing classification of the building under the Building Code of Australia.
The current use must be a lawful use and must not be an existing use within the meaning of section 4.65 of the Act.
The new use must be permissible in the land use zone in which it is carried out.
Must not involve any of the following—
the sale, storage or handling of food or the selling of liquor,
hairdressing or beauty salons,
premises for ear piercing, tattooing or other skin penetrating activities,
sex service premises or home occupation (sex services), or
restricted premises.
The existing use of the building must not be the subject of an approval incorporating an “Alternative Solution” under the Building Code of Australia.
Must not extend beyond existing approved hours of operation under a current development consent.
Must comply with any conditions of a current development consent relating to the site.
Must not involve the discharge of trade waste into the sewer drainage pipes or stormwater drainage systems without first obtaining written approval from the Council.
Must have appropriate cross connection control or back flow prevention devices installed in accordance with AS/NZS 3500 and the Plumbing Code of Australia.
Must not be located on a lot identified as “Flood Planning Area” on the Flood Planning Map.
The construction or installation of a clothes hoist or clothes line is development specified for this Schedule.
Must be located behind the front building alignment.

The construction or installation of a radio or satellite communications dish is development specified for this Schedule if it is only for the purpose of receiving television or radio signals (or both).
Must not be located on land within Zone RU5 in the village of Hill End.
Must not be greater than 1.8m in diameter.
Must not be greater than 1.8m above the highest point of the roof of the building.

If attached to a free standing structure, the structure must not be constructed within 1.2m of any 150mm diameter sewer main or 2m of any 225mm (or greater) diameter sewer main, or over any easement and must be clear of the zone of influence of any sewer main in accordance with the Council’s Drawing No. EN7902 available on the Council’s website.
The roof must be capable of supporting the additional load.
Must not be constructed over drainage pipes or any house drainage pipelines.
Must be located within the property boundary and not project over a public road.
The dish and supporting structure must be capable of supporting the dead and live (wind) loads which may be imposed upon them.
The dish, whether attached to a building or not, must not be visible from a road or other public place within a heritage conservation area.
Not more than one dish per building or tenancy.
Must not be constructed or installed on or in, or in relation to, a heritage item, unless it is free standing and located behind the front building line.

heading.b: Cubby houses, play equipment and shade structures

block.txt: The construction or installation of a cubby house, play equipment or shade structure is development specified for this Schedule.
Maximum height—3m (measured from natural ground level to the top of the structure).
If the floor level of any structure is more than 1m above the natural ground level, a balustrade and handrail must be provided in accordance with Part 3.9.2 of the Building Code of Australia.
Must not be used for habitable purposes.
Must be located—
behind the front building line for a boundary with a primary road, and
at least 900mm from a boundary with a secondary road or from a side or rear boundary, and
at least 20m from any boundary if located on land in Zone RU1, Zone RU2 or Zone RU4, and
at least 40m from a boundary adjoining the Mount Panorama Racing Circuit if located on land in Zone RU2.
Must be constructed or installed so that any stormwater from the roof is disposed of into an existing stormwater drainage system or other lawful place for stormwater discharge.
If connected to a fascia, must be connected in accordance with the specifications of a professional engineer.
Must be located in the rear yard if on a lot—
on which there is a heritage item or draft heritage item, or
that is located in a heritage conservation area or draft heritage conservation area.
Must be constructed of non-reflective materials or painted before use.
Must be 1.2m clear of any 150mm diameter sewer main or 2m clear of any 225mm (or greater) diameter sewer main.
Must not be constructed over any easement.
Must be clear of the zone of influence of any sewer main in accordance with the Council’s Drawing No. EN7902 available on the Council’s website.
Must not be constructed over drainage pipes or any house drainage.
Must not be located on a lot identified as “Flood Planning Area” on the Flood Planning Map.
The construction of a dam is development specified for this Schedule.
Must not be located on land in Zone R1, Zone R2, Zone E1 or Zone E2.
Must not be located on or across a perennial or intermittent named waterway, (including a wetland, stream, creek or river) without the approval of the NSW Office of Water.
Must be designed and constructed in accordance with the specifications of a professional engineer.
Must not have a surface area of more than 0.2ha.
Must be located—
at least 10m from any boundary, and
at least 40m from—
a boundary adjoining the Mount Panorama Racing Circuit if located on land in Zone RU2, or
a natural waterbody, wetland or environmentally sensitive area.
If on land within the vicinity of the Bathurst Airport, must be designed to reduce its attractiveness to bird life.
Must not be located on a lot identified as “Flood Planning Area” on the Flood Planning Map.
The demolition of a building or structure is development specified for this Schedule.
The site must not contain a heritage item, a draft heritage item or be located in a heritage conservation area or in a draft heritage conservation area.
The site must not be within the Bathurst Region Heritage Study 2007 or on the State Heritage Inventory database.
The building to be demolished must not be 50 or more years of age excluding buildings subject to the Council’s Bathurst Floodplain Management Plan.
Work must comply with the requirements of the Council’s demolition code.
Must be demolished in accordance with AS 2601—2001, The demolition of structures.

Any redundant plumbing and drainage must be capped off in accordance with AS 3500:2003, Plumbing and drainage set and the Plumbing Code of Australia, and the works inspected by the Council before the capped off works have been concealed.
Any electricity and telephone services must be disconnected before demolition work commences.

heading.b: Driveways, paths and paving (including driveways, footway crossings, carparks, loading facilities, hard stand spaces and manoeuvring areas)

block.txt: The construction or installation of a driveway, path and paving (including driveways, footway crossings, carparks, loading facilities, hard stand spaces and manoeuvring areas) is development specified for this Schedule.
Must take account of the Council’s Guidelines for Engineering Works in the construction of a driveway, path or paving.
Driveways and footway crossings must be constructed in accordance with access levels issued by the Council and must be inspected by the Council before pouring of the concrete.
If on land within Zone RU2 or Zone SP3, must not result in any alterations to an existing, or the creation of any new, access to the Mount Panorama Racing Circuit.
If a driveway for a corner lot, must be located at least 6m from the corner of the intersection.
Access to the Council’s sewer manholes must be maintained at all times.
All vehicle manoeuvring and car parking areas must be paved and line marked taking into account the Council’s Guidelines for Engineering Works.
Must not result in engineering services (including but not limited to sewer, stormwater and water mains) having inadequate cover taking into account the Council’s Guidelines for Engineering Works.
Earthworks and retaining walls are development specified for this Schedule.
For earthworks and retaining walls—
must not encroach onto or interfere with adjoining properties, including the Council road reserves,
must not be located on a lot identified as “Flood Planning Area” on the Flood Planning Map,
must not be constructed on, or in relation to, a heritage item or draft heritage item.
For earthworks—
maximum cut—1m below ground level (existing),
maximum fill—1m above ground level (existing),
must be set back from a side or rear boundary by at least the same amount as the depth of the cut or the height of the fill,
must not result in engineering services (including but not limited to sewer, stormwater and water mains) having inadequate cover taking into account the Council’s Guidelines for Engineering Works,
must use clean fill that is virgin excavated natural material (VENM),
must not cause nuisance to adjoining properties,
must not obstruct the natural flow of surface water,
if on land within Zone RU1, Zone RU2, Zone RU4 or Zone C4, must not be within 40m of a perennial or intermittent named waterway,
For retaining walls—
maximum height—1m or the depth or height of the associated cut or fill (whichever is the greater),
must be set back from a side or rear boundary by at least the same amount as the depth of the cut or the height of the fill,
must not be of timber construction if it provides support to a structure,
must be provided with drainage of sufficient design and capacity to prevent a build up of hydrostatic pressure behind the wall,
if constructed parallel, or less than 45°, to any sewer main, it must be clear of—
any 150mm diameter sewer main by 1.2m, or
any 225mm (or greater) diameter sewer main by 2m, or
any the Council’s rising (pumped) main of any size by 2m, and
the zone of influence of any sewer main in accordance with the Council’s Drawing No. EN7902 available on the Council’s website,
if constructed perpendicular, or not less than 45°, to the sewer main—
must only be over any 150mm or 225mm diameter sewer main, and
the support posts must be at least 500mm clear of the main sewer, and
must be designed to provide a minimum vertical clearance of 600mm between the footing and the main, and
if a reinforced concrete footing is proposed—must be designed as a bridging footing so that no loads are transferred to the sewer main,
all water and seepage must be disposed of entirely on the land and must not cause damage or nuisance to adjoining properties,
if of masonry construction—
must comply with AS 3700—2011, Masonry structures,
must comply with AS 3600—2009, Concrete structures,
must comply with AS/NZS 1170.0:2002, Structural design actions—General principles,

The temporary repair of any damage to a building or structure caused by an event that constitutes a significant and widespread danger to life or property in any zone in an area declared by an order under section 33 of the State Emergency and Rescue Management Act 1989 to be an area where a state of emergency exists is development specified for this Schedule.
Must be carried out within 6 months of the declaration being made.
Must not change the configuration of the floor space of the building or structure being repaired.
Must not increase the floor space of the building or structure being repaired.
Must be to make the building or structure weatherproof and, if a dwelling, suitable for habitation.
The construction or installation of a farm building or other structure used for the purpose of an agricultural activity is development specified for this Schedule.
Must be on land within Zone RU1, Zone RU2 or Zone RU4.
Maximum building height—
7m, or
if on a lot with an area greater than 4ha—12m.
Maximum height of stockyard fencing—4.5m.
Maximum gross floor area—
if on a lot with an area greater than 4ha—300m2.
Must be located—
if the stock holding yard is not used for commercial purposes, at least—
20m from a road, and
200m from a dwelling on another lot, and
50m from a side or rear boundary, and
100m from a waterbody, and
40m from a boundary adjoining the Mount Panorama Racing Circuit if located on land in Zone RU2, or
in any other case, at least—
20m from a road, and
50m from a dwelling on another lot, and
30m from a side or rear boundary, and
40m from a waterbody, and
40m from a boundary adjoining the Mount Panorama Racing Circuit if located on land in Zone RU2.
Must be designed and constructed in accordance with the specifications of a professional engineer.
If stockholding yards, must not be used for the commercial sale of livestock.
Must be constructed of non-reflective materials or painted before use, excluding silos.
If located on bush fire prone land and the structure is within 10m of a dwelling, the structure must comply with the requirements of AS 3959:2018, Construction of buildings in bushfire-prone areas.
Must not to be used for residential, industrial or commercial purposes.
Must be 1.2m clear of any 150mm diameter sewer main or 2m clear of any 225mm (or greater) diameter sewer main.
Must not be constructed over any easement.
Must be clear of the zone of influence of any sewer main in accordance with the Council’s Drawing No. EN7902 available on the Council’s website.
Must not be constructed over any drainage pipes or house drainage.
Must not be located on a lot identified as “Flood Planning Area” on the Flood Planning Map.
The construction or installation of a fence is development specified for this Schedule.
Must be on land in Zone RU2, RU5, R1, R2, R5, E1, E2, E3, E4, C2 or C4.
If forward of the building line on a boundary with a primary road—

maximum height (subject to the other provisions of this clause)—1.2m above ground level (existing) or, if of a stepped design on sloping ground, the highest point of each step may be up to 1.5m above ground level (existing) if the lowest point of each step is no more than 1.2m above ground level (existing), and
must be an open fence in mesh, slat or picket style.

If not forward of the building line on a boundary with a primary road (subject to the other provisions of this clause)—maximum height 1.8m above ground level (existing) or, if of a stepped design on sloping ground, the highest point of each step may be up to 2.2m above ground level (existing) if the lowest point of each step is no more than 1.8m above ground level (existing).
Must be constructed of timber or appropriate traditional materials if—
on a lot, or on a boundary with a lot, on which there is a heritage item or draft heritage item, or
in a heritage conservation area or draft heritage conservation area.
If located on land in Zone RU5 within the village of Hill End—must be constructed of timber and be picket, palisade or rough timber paling style.

If located on land in Zone RU2, Zone RU5 (other than within the village of Hill End), Zone R2, Zone R5, Zone C2 or Zone C4—must be constructed of traditional rural fencing materials (including pipe, steel, timber or masonry).
If located on land in Zone E3 or Zone E4—
maximum height—2.1m above ground level (existing), and
must be an open fence in mesh or palisade style.
For masonry construction—
maximum height—1m above ground level (existing), and
must be 1.2m clear of any 150mm diameter sewer main or 2m clear of any 225mm (or greater) diameter sewer main, and
must not be constructed over any easement, and
must be clear of the zone of influence of any sewer main in accordance with the Council’s Drawing No. EN7902 available on the Council’s website, and
must comply with AS 3700—2018, Masonry structures, and
must comply with AS 3600—2018, Concrete structures.
Must not be an electric fence.
Must not be located on a lot identified as “Flood Planning Area” on the Flood Planning Map.
Any entrance gate must not open outwards from the property.
If constructed of metal components—must be of low reflective, factory pre-coloured materials.
If located on bush fire prone land—must be constructed of non-combustible material or hardwood.

If located on land that is core koala habitat within the meaning of State Environmental Planning Policy (Biodiversity and Conservation) 2021, Chapter 3 or 4 or in a movement corridor used by koalas—must be installed or constructed in accordance with the Guideline, and any relevant approved plan of management, under that Policy.
The construction or installation of a flagpole is development specified for this Schedule.
Maximum height—6m (unless attached to a building in which case the height must not exceed 3m above the highest point of the ridge line of the building).
The bottom end of the flag must be not less than 3.6m above the pathway level of the road.
Must be erected within the property boundary.
Must not project over the carriageway of a public road.
Must not interfere with public services.
Must be designed and constructed so it is structurally sound and capable of supporting the dead and live (wind) loads which may be imposed on the development and the supporting structure.
If on land within Zone R1, Zone R2, Zone RU5 or Zone R5, only one per property.
If the flag is used for commercial advertising, it must directly relate to a lawful commercial activity approved on the land on which the flagpole is erected.
Must be 1.2m clear of any 150mm diameter sewer main or 2m clear of any 225mm (or greater) diameter sewer main.
Must not be constructed over any easement.
Must be clear of the zone of influence of any sewer main in accordance with the Council’s Drawing No. EN7902 available on the Council’s website.
Must not be constructed over any drainage pipes or any house drainage.
Must not be located on a lot identified as “Flood Planning Area” on the Flood Planning Map.
The construction or installation of an above ground fuel tank or gas storage facility for agricultural activity is development specified for this Schedule.
Must be located on land within Zone RU1, Zone RU2 or Zone RU4 on a lot larger than 2ha.
Must not have a capacity of more than—
for a fuel tank—5,000L, or
for a gas tank—1,000L.
Must be located at least 20m from the primary road frontage of the lot and at least 10m from each other lot boundary.
Must be bunded with the capacity to contain at least 110% of the capacity of the tank.

If a fuel tank—must be constructed of prefabricated metal, be freestanding and installed in accordance with the requirements of AS 1940—2004, The storage and handling of flammable and combustible liquids.
If a gas tank—must be designed and constructed in accordance with the requirements of AS/NZS 1596:2014, The storage and handling of LP Gas.
Must not be used for advertising.
Must be located at least 1m from any registered easement, sewer main or water main.
Must not be located on a lot identified as “Flood Planning Area” on the Flood Planning Map.
Other legislative requirements also apply in relation to workplace health and safety issues.
The construction of a cabana, gazebo, greenhouse or fernery is development specified for this Schedule.
Must not be on land within Zone RU5 in the village of Hill End.
Maximum building height—2.4m.
Maximum gross floor area—20m2.
Must be located—
behind the front building line for a boundary with a primary road, and
at least 900mm from a boundary with a secondary road or from a side or rear boundary, and
at least 20m from any boundary if located on land in Zone RU1, Zone RU2 or Zone RU4, and
at least 40m from a boundary adjoining the Mount Panorama Racing Circuit if located on land in Zone RU2.
Must be constructed or installed so that any stormwater from the roof is disposed of into an existing stormwater drainage system or other lawful place for stormwater discharge.
If on a lot in a heritage conservation area or draft heritage conservation area—must be of a colour that matches the main building on the lot.
If located over the existing house drainage pipelines—access to the inspection openings must be maintained at all times.
Must be constructed of non-reflective materials or painted before use.
Must be 1.2m clear of any 150mm diameter sewer main or 2m clear of any 225mm (or greater) diameter sewer main.
Must not be constructed over any easement.
Must be clear of the zone of influence of any sewer main in accordance with the Council’s Drawing No. EN7902 available on the Council’s website.
Must not be located on a lot identified as “Flood Planning Area” on the Flood Planning Map.
The construction of a garbage bin enclosure is development specified for this Schedule.
Must be located at or behind the building line.
Must be located 450mm from each side and rear boundary.
If constructed of metal components—must be of low reflective, factory pre-coloured materials.
If it is located on bush fire prone land and less than 5m from a dwelling, must be constructed of non-combustible material.

heading.b: Goal posts, sight screens and similar sporting structures

block.txt: The construction of goal posts, sight screens and similar sporting structures is development specified for this Schedule.
Must only be erected on sporting or playing fields used for sporting events.
Must not be constructed over the Council’s sewer and sewer inspection openings.
External lighting must comply with AS 4282—1997, Control of the obtrusive effects of outdoor lighting.
The installation of a hot water heater or a hot water storage tank is development specified for this Schedule.
Must be installed in accordance with the manufacturers specifications.
All work is carried out by a licensed plumber in accordance with the requirements of AS/NZS 3500 and the Plumbing Code of Australia.
If within a heritage conservation area or within the curtilage of a heritage item—the proposed heater must not be visible from a road or public place.

The installation of interpretive signs, being a sign that displays interpretive information for a building or place of a historic, environmental or scenic nature, is development specified for this schedule.
Must not obstruct the sight line of vehicle or pedestrian traffic.
Must not be larger than would otherwise be required to interpret the site.
The construction or installation of landscaping structures and privacy screens is development specified for this Schedule.
Must be located wholly within the property boundary.
Must not be higher than 3m.
The construction or installation of a letterbox, whether free standing or in groups, is development specified for this Schedule.
Must be structurally adequate.
Must be erected within the property boundary, except on land within Zone RU1 or Zone RU4.

If on land within Zone RU1 or Zone RU4, must be located to allow adequate clearance for parked postal vehicles from passing traffic and not interfere with the movement of traffic and the sight distances of drivers.
Must be constructed in accordance with Australia Post Guidelines.
The construction or installation of outdoor lighting is development specified for this Schedule.
Maximum height—3m.
If within the vicinity of the Bathurst Airport—must be positioned so as to comply with the CASA guidelines for lighting in the vicinity of airports.
Must comply with AS 4282—1997, Control of the obtrusive effects of outdoor lighting.
Must be fully shielded and point downwards.
Must not be upward lighting of advertising signs or shop front lighting.
Fittings and supporting structures must be designed and located so that there is no light spill onto adjoining properties.
The painting and rendering of buildings is development specified for this Schedule.
Must not be located on land within Zone E2.
